ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Transport] Messages MUST be transported using HTTP [or HTTPS] using the default ports for these protocols.
[In Transport] Messages MUST be transported using [HTTP or] HTTPS using the default ports for these protocols.
[In Message Syntax] This section contains common definitions used by this protocol.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] The following HTTP header MUST be included in all WOPI requests: Authorization
[In Custom HTTP Headers] Header Authorization defined in [RFC2616].
[In Custom HTTP Headers] Authorization header MUST have the value "Bearer " + <token> as specified in section 2.2.2.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] Note that Authorization header must be a space between "Bearer" and <token>.

[In Custom HTTP Headers] The following HTTP headers MAY be included with all WOPI requests: X-WOPI-AppEndpoint X-WOPI-ClientVersion X-WOPI-MachineName X-WOPI-PerfTraceRequested X-WOPI-CorrelationID X-WOPI-UsingRestrictedScenario X-WOPI-Proof X-WOPI-ProofOld X-WOPI-TimeStamp
[In Custom HTTP Headers] Header X-WOPI-AppEndpoint is A string specifying the endpoint of the WOPI client sending the request.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] This string MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] Header X-WOPI-ClientVersion is a string specifying the version of the WOPI client.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] There is no standard for how this [X-WOPI-ClientVersion] string is to be formatted.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] This [X-WOPI-ClientVersion] string MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] Header X-WOPI-MachineName is a string indicating the name of the machine making the call, which MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] X-WOPI-PerfTraceRequested is a Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI client has requested the WOPI server to return a value for X-WOPI-PerfTrace.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] Header X-WOPI-CorrelationID a string that the WOPI server MAY use when logging server activity to correlate that activity with WOPI client activity.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] Header X-WOPI-UsingRestrictedScenario is a restricted scenario is a case where a user is able to operate on a file in a limited way.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] For example, a user might be allowed to change a file in the course of filling out a form while not having permission to freely edit the file.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] The[X-WOPI-UsingRestrictedScenario] value of this header varies depending on the scenario.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] The value of X-WOPI-UsingRestrictedScenario header is determined through convention understood by the client and server implementer.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] The X-WOPI-UsingRestrictedScenario header MUST be present.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] The header value MUST be correct in cases where the WOPI action (see section 3.1.5.1.1.2.2.4) represents a restricted scenario.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] Header X-WOPI-Proof is a set of data signed using a SHA256 (A 256 bit SHA-2-encoded [FIPS180-2]) encryption algorithm.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] The value of X-WOPI-Proof is decrypted using the values provided in ct_proof-key (section 3.1.5.1.1.2.2.5) in Discovery (section 3.1.5.1.1) as the public key.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] The value of X-WOPI-Proof MUST match the following pattern.

[In Custom HTTP Headers] [The value of X-WOPI-Proof MUST match the following pattern] 4 bytes in network byte order representing the length of the <token> (see section 2.2.2) as an integer + the <token> represented in UTF-8 [UNICODE] + 4 bytes in network byte order representing the length of the URL of the WOPI request as an integer + the absolute URL of the WOPI request in uppercase + 4 bytes in network byte order representing the length of X-WOPI-TimeStamp (see this section) + the value of X-WOPI-TimeStamp.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] This data is then signed as described above.

[In Custom HTTP Headers] The intent of passing X-WOPI-Proof header is to allow the WOPI server to validate that the WOPI request originated from the WOPI client that provided the public key in Discovery via ct_wopi-proof-key.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] Header X-WOPI-ProofOld is a set of data signed using a SHA256 (A 256 bit SHA-2-encoded [FIPS180-2]) encryption algorithm.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] The value of X-WOPI-ProofOld is decrypted using the values provided in ct_proof-key (section 3.1.5.1.1.2.2.5) in Discovery (section 3.1.5.1.1) as the public key.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] The value of X-WOPI-ProofOld MUST match the following pattern.

[In Custom HTTP Headers] [The value of X-WOPI-Proof MUST match the following pattern] 4 bytes in network byte order representing the length of the <token> (see section 2.2.2) as an integer + the <token> represented in UTF-8 [UNICODE] + 4 bytes in network byte order representing the length of the URL of the WOPI request as an integer + the absolute URL of the WOPI request in uppercase + 4 bytes in network byte order representing the length of X-WOPI-TimeStamp (see this section) + the value of X-WOPI-TimeStamp
[In Custom HTTP Headers] This data is then signed as described above.

[In Custom HTTP Headers] The intent of passing X-WOPI-ProofOld header is to allow the WOPI server to validate that the WOPI request originated from the WOPI client that provided the public key in Discovery via ct_proof-key.

[In Custom HTTP Headers] Header X-WOPI-TimeStamp is a 64-bit integer that represents the number of 100-nanosecond intervals that have elapsed between 12:00:00 midnight, January 1, 0001 and the time of the request.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] The WOPI client MUST include this HTTP header if it includes X-WOPI-Proof [or X-WOPI-ProofOld].
[In Custom HTTP Headers] The WOPI client MUST include this HTTP header if it includes [X-WOPI-Proof or] X-WOPI-ProofOld.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] The following HTTP headers can be included with all WOPI responses: X-WOPI-HostEndpoint X-WOPI-ServerVersion X-WOPI-MachineName X-WOPI-PerfTrace X-WOPI-ServerError
[In Custom HTTP Headers] Header X-WOPI-HostEndpoint is a string specifying the endpoint of the WOPI server handling the request.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] [X-WOPI-HostEndpoint] This string MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] Header X-WOPI-ServerVersion is a string specifying the version of the WOPI server [and MUST be included with all WOPI responses.]
[In Custom HTTP Headers] Header X-WOPI-ServerVersion [is a string specifying the version of the WOPI server and] MUST be included with all WOPI responses.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] There is no standard for how this[X-WOPI-ServerVersion] string is to be formatted.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] [X-WOPI-ServerVersion] This string MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.

[In Custom HTTP Headers] Header X-WOPI-MachineName is a string specifying the name of the WOPI server and MUST be included with all WOPI responses, which MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] Header X-WOPI-PerfTrace is a string that the WOPI client MAY use to track performance data.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] It is included in a WOPI response if the header X-WOPI-PerfTraceRequest in the request is present and equal to "true".
[In Custom HTTP Headers] Header X-WOPI-ServerError is a string indicating that an error occurred while processing the WOPI request, which is included in a WOPI response if the status code is 500.
[In Custom HTTP Headers] This[X-WOPI-ServerError] string MAY include details about the error.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-LISTSWS_R793001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Custom HTTP Headers] This[X-WOPI-ServerError ] string MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.
[In Common URI Parameters] The following URI parameters MUST be included with all WOPI requests: <token> <id>
[In Common URI Parameters] The <token> is a string used by the WOPI server to determine the identity of the issuer of the WOPI request.
[In Common URI Parameters] The token is generated by the WOPI server.
[In Common URI Parameters] The token is learned by the WOPI client before the first WOPI request.
[In Common URI Parameters] The WOPI server passes the token to the WOPI client in the initiating request described in section 3.1.5.1.1.2.3.3.
[In Common URI Parameters] The WOPI client requires no understanding of the format or content of the token.
[In Common URI Parameters] The token SHOULD expire after a length of time deemed reasonable by the implementer of the WOPI server.
[In Common URI Parameters] The token SHOULD only provide access to resources associated with the WOPI request.
[In Common URI Parameters] That is, the token SHOULD be scoped to a specific user and set of resources.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R59.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Common URI Parameters] The <id> is the id represents the file or folder being operated on by the WOPI client.
[In Common URI Parameters] A WOPI server MUST issue a unique id for any resource that a WOPI client operates on.
[In Common URI Parameters] The <token> and <id> parameters are a core part of all WOPI requests.
[In Common URI Parameters] The URI syntax for using these parameters is described first in the CheckFileInfo operation (see section 3.3.5.1.1).
[In Common URI Parameters] The WOPI server provides both <token> and <id> through the urlsrc parameter, as described in the st_wopi-url-source simple type (see section 3.1.5.1.1.2.3.3).
[In Common URI Parameters] The following URI parameters MAY be included with all WOPI requests: <sc>
[In Common URI Parameters] The sc is a string that the WOPI server MAY include with a WOPI request.
[In Common URI Parameters] The WOPI client MAY in turn return the value of sc as the value of the X-WOPI-SessionContext HTTP header when making the CheckFileInfo (section 3.3.5.1.1) WOPI requests.
[In Common URI Parameters]The WOPI client MAY in turn return the value of sc as the value of the X-WOPI-SessionContext HTTP header when making the CheckFolderInfo (section 3.3.5.2.1) WOPI requests.
[In WOPI Discovery Details] The WOPI client provides XML [RFC3023] that describes the supported abilities of the WOPI client and how to invoke these abilities through URIs.
[In WOPI Discovery Details] This XML is available through a predetermined URI that MUST be provided by a WOPI client.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] WOPI Discovery involves a single URI that takes no parameters: HTTP://server/hosting/discovery

[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] The resource of HTTP://server/hosting/discovery provides access to information about the capabilities of a WOPI client and the mechanisms for invoking those abilities through URIs.

[In HTTP://server/hosting/discovery] The data that describes the supported abilities of the WOPI client and how to call these abilities through URIs is provided through the following URI: HTTP://server/hosting/discovery
[In HTTP://server/hosting/discovery] The operation Discovery returns data that describes the supported abilities of the WOPI client and how to call these abilities through URIs.
[In Discovery] The operation that returns data that describes the supported abilities of the WOPI client and how to invoke these abilities through URIs.
[In Response Body] The WOPI Discovery response is XML [RFC3023] with the following characteristics.
[In Elements] This section describes the elements of the WOPI Discovery XML.
[In wopi-discovery] A ct_wopi-discovery element (section 3.1.5.1.1.2.2.1) specifies the capabilities and URIs for accessing the capabilities of the WOPI client.
[In wopi-discovery] This element is the root element of WOPI Discovery XML.
[In wopi-discovery] The following W3C XML schema ([XMLSCHEMA1] section 2.1) fragment specifies the contents of this element.

[In wopi-discovery] [The following W3C XML schema ([XMLSCHEMA1] section 2.1) fragment specifies the contents of this element.] <xs:element name="wopi-discovery" minOccurs="1" MaxOccurs="1" type="ct_wopi-discovery"/>
[In Complex Types] The following XML schema complex type definitions are specific to this operation.
[In ct_wopi-discovery] This ct_wopi-discovery complex type specifies the capabilities and URIs for accessing the capabilities of the WOPI client.

[In ct_wopi-discovery] [The ct_wopi-discovery complex type definition follows:] <xs:complexType name="ct_wopi-discovery"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="net-zone" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="4" type="ct_net-zone"/> <xs:element name="proof-key" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="ct_proof-key"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In ct_net-zone] This ct_net-zone complex type specifies the protocol and the intended network-type of the ct_app-name type elements (section 3.1.5.1.1.2.2.3) it contains.

[In ct_net-zone] [The ct_net-zone complex type definition follows:] <xs:complexType name="ct_net-zone"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="app" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded" type="ct_app-name"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="name" type="st_wopi-zone"/> </xs:complexType>
[In ct_app-name] The ct_app-name complex type specifies the application name that a set of WOPI actions are grouped under.
[In ct_app-name] The application name is intended as a convenient way of grouping similar actions such as all those pertaining to spreadsheets.

[In ct_app-name] It is not required that all actions contained within an element of this type have the same file extension or progid (a string that identifies a folder as being associated with a specific application).
[In ct_app-name] name: A string attribute that specifies the name of the application.
[In ct_app-name] favIconUrl: A string attribute that specifies the URL of an image resource that a WOPI server MAY use as the Favorites Icon for a page showing the output of a WOPI client.
[In ct_app-name] checkLicense: A Boolean attribute that specifies that a WOPI server SHOULD enforce license restrictions for file types within the ct_app-name block.

[In ct_app-name] [The ct_app-name complex type definition follows:] <xs:complexType name="ct_app-name"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="action" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded" type="ct_wopi-action"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="name" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="favIconUrl" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="checkLicense" type="xs:boolean" use="optional" default="false"/> </xs:complexType>
[In ct_wopi-action] The ct_wopi-action complex type specifies an action (such as viewing a file) that a WOPI client can perform.
[In ct_wopi-action] name: A st_wopi-action-values attribute (section 3.1.5.1.1.2.3.1) that specifies the name of the action.
[In ct_wopi-action] default: A Boolean attribute that specifies whether the WOPI server is to use this action as the default action for this file type.
[In ct_wopi-action] requires: A st_wopi-action-requirements attribute (section 3.1.5.1.1.2.3.2) that specifies the required capabilities of the WOPI server in order to be able to use this action.
[In ct_wopi-action] urlsrc: A st_wopi-url-source attribute (section 3.1.5.1.1.2.3.3) that specifies the URI that the WOPI server can use to call the action.
[In ct_wopi-action] ext: A string attribute that specifies the file extension supported by this action.
[In ct_wopi-action] [ext] Note that either ext or progid MUST be present, but that ext and progid MUST NOT be present in the same action.
[In ct_wopi-action] progid: A string attribute that specifies the progid (a string that identifies a folder as being associated with a specific application) supported by this action.
[In ct_wopi-action] [progid] Note that either ext or progid MUST be present, but that ext and progid MUST NOT be present in the same action.
[In ct_wopi-action] newprogid: A string attribute that specifies the progid that the editnew (see st_wopi-action-values in section 3.1.5.1.1.2.3.1) will use for the new file.
[In ct_wopi-action] [newprogid] Note that either newext or newprogid MUST be present when using editnew but that newext and newprogid MUST NOT be present in the same action.
[In ct_wopi-action] newext: A string attribute that specifies the file extension that the editnew (see st_wopi-action-values in section 3.1.5.1.1.2.3.1) will use for the new file.
[In ct_wopi-action] [newext] Note that either newext or newprogid MUST be present when using editnew, but that newext and newprogid MUST NOT be present in the same action.
[In ct_wopi-action] useParent: A Boolean attribute that specifies that the WOPI server MUST call the WOPI action on the parent folder of the file.
[In ct_wopi-action] [useParent] The following W3C XML schema ([XMLSCHEMA1] section 2.1) fragment specifies the contents of this complex type.

[In ct_wopi-action] [The ct_wopi-action complex type definition follows:] <xs:complexType name="ct_wopi-action"> <xs:attribute name="name" use="required" type="st_wopi-action-values"/> <xs:attribute name="default" type="xs:boolean" default="false"/> <xs:attribute name="requires" type="st_wopi-action-requirements"/> <xs:attribute name="urlsrc" use="required" type="st_wopi-url-source"/> <xs:attribute name="ext" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="progid" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="newprogid" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="newext" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="useParent" type:"xs:boolean" default="false"/> </xs:complexType>
[In ct_proof-key] The ct_proof-key complex type specifies two public keys that a WOPI server uses to decrypt the values passed in the X-WOPI-Proof and X-WOPI-ProofOld HTTP headers (section 2.2.1).
[In ct_proof-key] Note that the public keys passed in this complex type decrypt either of the HTTP header values.
[In ct_proof-key] The public keys are specified in two different formats.
[In ct_proof-key] If you include proof keys in discovery, you SHOULD include X-WOPI-Proof and X-WOPI-ProofOld HTTP headers (section 2.2.1) in all WOPI requests.
[In ct_proof-key] oldvalue: A base64-encoded value representing public key information that is compatible with the unmanaged Microsoft Cryptographic API ([MSDN-CAPI]).
[In ct_proof-key] value: A base64-encoded value representing public key information that is compatible with the unmanaged Microsoft Cryptographic API ([MSDN-CAPI]).
[In ct_proof-key] modulus: A base64-encoded value representing the RSA modulus as described in [RFC3447] section A.1.1.
[In ct_proof-key] modulus: This modulus value MUST only be used with the value of the exponent attribute to produce a complete public key.
[In ct_proof-key] oldmodulus: A base64-encoded value representing the RSA modulus as described in [RFC3447] section A.1.1.
[In ct_proof-key] oldmodulus: This modulus value MUST only be used with the value of the oldexponent attribute to produce a complete public key.
[In ct_proof-key] exponent: A base64-encoded ([RFC4648]) value representing the RSA publicExponent as described in [RFC3447] section A.1.1.
[In ct_proof-key] exponent: This exponent value MUST only be used with the value of the modulus attribute to produce a complete public key.
[In ct_proof-key] oldexponent: A base64-encoded ([RFC4648]) value representing the RSA publicExponent as described in [RFC3447] section A.1.1.
[In ct_proof-key] oldexponent: This exponent value MUST only be used with the value of the oldmodulus attribute to produce a complete public key.
[In ct_proof-key] [value] The following W3C XML schema ([XMLSCHEMA1] section 2.1) fragment specifies the contents of this complex type.

[In ct_proof-key] [The ct_proof-key complex type definition follows:] <xs:complexType name="ct_proof-key"> <xs:attribute name="exponent" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="modulus" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="oldexponent" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="oldmodulus" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="oldvalue" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="value" type="xs:string" use="required"/> </xs:complexType>
[In Simple Types] The following XML schema simple type definitions are specific to this operation.
[In st_wopi-action-values] This simple type specifies all the well-known WOPI actions that a WOPI client and WOPI server MAY support.
[In st_wopi-action-values] It is important to note that while the following schema restricts this type, WOPI servers MUST NOT fail when they encounter additional values not included in this schema.
[In st_wopi-action-values] view: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports viewing the file type.
[In st_wopi-action-values] [view] All WOPI clients MUST support this action for all file types that they support.
[In st_wopi-action-values] edit: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports editing the file type.
[In st_wopi-action-values] mobileview: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports a view of the file type that is optimized for viewing on mobile devices such as cellular phones.
[In st_wopi-action-values] embedview: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports a view of the file that can be embedded in a web page.
[In st_wopi-action-values] embededit: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports an editable view of the file that can be embedded in a web page.
[In st_wopi-action-values] present: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports a broadcast of the file.

[In st_wopi-action-values] [present] A broadcast is a special view that is driven by one or more presenters from a client for the purposes of being viewed by a set of attendees viewing in separate clients.
[In st_wopi-action-values] [present] The present action is associated with the URI used by presenters.
[In st_wopi-action-values] presentservice: An action that indicates the location of a broadcast endpoint for broadcast presenters.
[In st_wopi-action-values] [presentservice] Interaction with the endpoint is described in [MS-OBPRS].
[In st_wopi-action-values] attendservice: An action that indicates the location of a broadcast endpoint for broadcast attendees.
[In st_wopi-action-values] [attendservice] Interaction with the endpoint is described in [MS-OBPAS].
[In st_wopi-action-values] attend: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports a broadcast of the file.

[In st_wopi-action-values] [attend] A broadcast is a special view that is driven by one or more presenters from a client for the purposes of being viewed by a set of attendees viewing in separate clients.
[In st_wopi-action-values] [attend] The attend action is associated with the URI used by attendees.
[In st_wopi-action-values] editnew: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports the creation of a new file based on the file provided by the WOPI server.

[In st_wopi-action-values] [editnew] The newext and newprogid attributes defined by the ct_wopi-action complex type (see section 3.1.5.1.1.2.2.4) indicate the type of file that will result from invoking the editnew action.
[In st_wopi-action-values] imagepreview: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports providing an image preview of the file type.
[In st_wopi-action-values] interactivepreview: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports providing an interactive preview of the file type.
[In st_wopi-action-values] [interactivepreview] For example, a smaller version of a presentation that a user can still advance from slide to slide.
[In st_wopi-action-values] formsubmit: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports accepting changes to the file type via a form-style interface.
[In st_wopi-action-values] [formsubmit] For example, a user might be able to use this action to change the content of a workbook even if they did not have permission to use the edit action.

[In st_wopi-action-values] formedit: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports editing the file type in a mode better suited to working with files that have been used to collect form data via the formsubmit action.
[In st_wopi-action-values] rest: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports interacting with the file type via additional URL parameters that are specific to the file type in question.
[In st_wopi-action-values] [rest] The following W3C XML schema ([XMLSCHEMA1] section 2.1) fragment specifies the contents of this simple type.
[In st_wopi-action-values] preloadview: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports preloading static content prior to using the view action.
[In st_wopi-action-values] preloadedit: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports preloading static content prior to using the edit action.
[In st_wopi-action-values] rtc: An action that indicates the location of a real-time communication endpoint for the file type.
[In st_wopi-action-values] getinfo: An action that indicates that the WOPI client supports retrieving additional information about the WOPI client in relation to the file type.

[In st_wopi-action-values] [The st_wopi-action-values simple type definition follows:] <xs:simpleType name="st_wopi-action-values"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="view" /> <xs:enumeration value="edit" /> <xs:enumeration value="mobileview" /> <xs:enumeration value="embedview" /> <xs:enumeration value="embededit" /> <xs:enumeration value="mobileclient" /> <xs:enumeration value="present" /> <xs:enumeration value="presentservice" /> <xs:enumeration value="attend" /> <xs:enumeration value="attendservice" /> <xs:enumeration value="editnew" /> <xs:enumeration value="imagepreview" /> <xs:enumeration value="interactivepreview" /> <xs:enumeration value="formsubmit" /> <xs:enumeration value="formedit" /> <xs:enumeration value="rest" /> <xs:enumeration value="preloadview" /> <xs:enumeration value="preloadedit" /> <xs:enumeration value="rtc" /> <xs:enumeration value="getinfo" /> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType>
[In st_wopi-action-requirements] The st_wopi-action-requirements simple type specifies the capabilities that a WOPI server MUST support to call the associated WOPI action.

[In st_wopi-action-requirements] It is important to note that while the following schema restricts this type to well-known requirements, WOPI servers MUST NOT fail when they encounter additional values not included in this schema.
[In st_wopi-action-requirements] update: Indicates that the WOPI server MUST support changes to the file through PutFile (see section 3.3.5.3.2)

[In st_wopi-action-requirements] locks: Indicates that the WOPI server MUST support the ability to lock the file for editing through Lock (see section 3.3.5.1.3 ), Unlock (see section 3.3.5.1.4), RefreshLock (see section 3.3.5.1.5), and UnlockAndRelock (see section 3.3.5.1.6).

[In st_wopi-action-requirements] cobalt: Indicates that the WOPI server MUST support the system described in [MS-FSSHTTP] through ExecuteCellStorageRequest (see section 3.3.5.1.8) and ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest (see section 3.3.5.1.9).

[In st_wopi-action-requirements] containers: Indicates that the WOPI server supports accessing folders and folder hierarchy through EnumerateChildren (see section 3.3.5.4.1), CheckFolderInfo (see section 3.3.5.2.1), and DeleteFile (see section 3.3.5.1.10).
[In st_wopi-action-requirements] [containers] The following W3C XML schema ([XMLSCHEMA1] section 2.1) fragment specifies the contents of this simple type.

[In st_wopi-action-requirements] [The st_wopi-action-requirements simple type definition follows:] <xs:simpleType name="st_wopi-action-requirements"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="/^((update|locks|cobalt|containers)\s*(,\s*|$))* ((update|locks|cobalt|containers)\s*$)/" /> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType>
[In st_wopi-url-source] The st_wopi-url-source simple type specifies the URI that is used to call the associated WOPI action.

[In st_wopi-url-source] When a WOPI server receives a request from the browser that is required to use a WOPI action, an HTTP POST request MUST be sent from the WOPI server that navigates the browser along with a query string WOPISrc parameter and the access_token access token as the request body.
[In st_wopi-url-source] A WOPI server can also send an access_token_TTL as the request body.
[In st_wopi-url-source] access_token: A parameter that is the <token> (see section 2.2.2).
[In st_wopi-url-source] [access_token] The URI parameter MUST have the form "access_token=<token>".
[In st_wopi-url-source] [access_token] Because the token represents user credentials it needs to be protected.
[In st_wopi-url-source] [access_token] To protect the token the WOPI client MUST accept the token as part of the body of an HTTP POST.
[In st_wopi-url-source] [access_token] The format of the POST body MUST be "access_token=<token>"
[In st_wopi-url-source] [access_token] The WOPI client SHOULD NOT include the URI parameter access_token and the POST body content in the same request.
[In st_wopi-url-source] access_token_TTL: A 64-bit integer containing the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 UTC and representing the expiration date and time stamp of the access_token.
[In st_wopi-url-source] [access_token_TTL] The WOPI client MUST accept the access_token_TTL as part of the body of an HTTP POST.
[In st_wopi-url-source] [access_token_TTL] The format of the POST body MUST be "access_token_TTL=[a 64-bit integer as described above]"
[In st_wopi-url-source] [access_token_TTL] The WOPI client SHOULD NOT include the URI parameter access_token_TTL and the POST body content in the same request.
[In st_wopi-url-source] WOPISrc: A URI that conforms to the pattern http://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id> (see section 3.3.5.1).
[In st_wopi-url-source] [WOPISrc] The URI MUST be encoded to a URL string.
[In st_wopi-url-source] [WOPISrc] There are a number of optional query string parameters that this simple type may contain.

[In st_wopi-url-source] [WOPISrc] As described in the following, the WOPI servers MUST replace each optional parameter when using URI of this type, either by removing them, or processing them by providing the corresponding string in place of the placeholder value.
[In st_wopi-url-source] [WOPISrc] Each optional parameter conforms to the pattern <name=PLACEHOLDER_VALUE[&]>.

[In st_wopi-url-source] [WOPISrc] The WOPI server MAY omit the optional parameter, but MUST only process it if the placeholder value is understood and the corresponding replacement value can be determined.
[In st_wopi-url-source] [WOPISrc] If the value is understood, the "<" and ">" MUST be removed, the name left intact, and the optional "&" MUST be preserved if present.
[In st_wopi-url-source] [WOPISrc] . As an example, "<ui=UI_LLCC&>" could be rewritten to "ui=en-us&".
[In st_wopi-url-source] UI_LLCC: Indicates that the WOPI server MAY include the preferred UI language in the format described in [RFC1766].
[In st_wopi-url-source] DC_LLCC: Indicates that the WOPI server MAY include preferred data language in the format described in [RFC1766] for cases where language can affect data calculation.
[In st_wopi-url-source] EMBEDDED: Indicates that the WOPI server MAY include the value "true" to use the output of this action embedded in a web page.
[In st_wopi-url-source] DISABLE_ASYNC: Indicates that the WOPI server MAY include the value "true" to prevent the attendee from navigating a file.
[In st_wopi-url-source] [DISABLE_ASYNC] For example, when using the attendee action (see st_wopi-action-values in section 3.1.5.1.1.2.3.1).
[In st_wopi-url-source] DISABLE_BROADCAST: Indicates that the WOPI server MAY include the value "true" to load a view of the document that does not create or join a broadcast session.
[In st_wopi-url-source] [DISABLE_BROADCAST] This view looks and behaves like a regular broadcast frame.
[In st_wopi-url-source] FULLSCREEN: Indicates that the WOPI server MAY include the value "true" to load the file type in full-screen mode.
[In st_wopi-url-source] RECORDING: Indicates that the WOPI server MAY include the value "true" to load the file type with a minimal user interface.
[In st_wopi-url-source] THEME_ID: Indicates that the WOPI server MAY include a value to designate the theme used.
[In st_wopi-url-source] [THEME_ID] Current values are "1" to indicate a light-colored theme [and "2" to indicate a darker colored theme].
[In st_wopi-url-source] [THEME_ID] Current values are ["1" to indicate a light-colored theme and] "2" to indicate a darker colored theme.
BUSINESS_USER: Indicates that the WOPI server MAY include the value "1" to indicate that the user is a business user.
DISABLE_CHAT: Indicates that the WOPI server MAY include the value "1" to load a view of the document that does not create or join a chat session.
[In st_wopi-url-source] The following W3C XML schema ([XMLSCHEMA1] section 2.1) fragment specifies the contents of this simple type.
[In st_wopi-url-source] Additionally, WOPI servers MUST append to the WOPISrc any query string parameters included with the WOPI server URL that begin with the characters: "wd".

[In st_wopi-url-source] That is, if the WOPI server receives a request from a browser that indicates to the WOPI server that the browser wishes to call a WOPI client action, then all query string parameters included on the request to the WOPI server MUST be passed through on the WOPISrc.
[In st_wopi-zone] The st_wopi-zone simple type indicates the supported protocols, and the preferred network environments of each set of WOPI actions.
[In st_wopi-zone] internal-http: Indicates that the WOPI actions associated with this type are intended for use on internal networks (not internet or extranet networks) and use the HTTP protocol.
[In st_wopi-zone] internal-https: Indicates that the WOPI actions associated with this type are intended for use on internal networks (not internet or extranet networks) and use the HTTPS protocol
[In st_wopi-zone] external-http: Indicates that the WOPI actions associated with this type are intended for use on internet or extranet networks and use the HTTP protocol.
[In st_wopi-zone] external-https: Indicates that the WOPI actions associated with this type are intended for use on internet or extranet networks and use the HTTPS protocol.
[In st_wopi-zone] The following W3C XML schema ([XMLSCHEMA1] section 2.1) fragment specifies the contents of this simple type.

[In st_wopi-zone] [The st_wopi-zone simple type definition follows:] <xs:simpleType name="st_wopi-zone"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="internal-http" /> <xs:enumeration value="internal-https" /> <xs:enumeration value="external-http" /> <xs:enumeration value="external-https" /> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType>
[In Processing Details] WOPI servers are expected to use the contents of WOPI Discovery XML to associate the functionality described in the XML with the file types in the XML.

[In Processing Details] A WOPI server MAY choose to associate any set of the functionality described in WOPI Discovery XML but the WOPI server MUST only expose actions that are known to it and that have requirements that it understands and can meet.

[In WOPI Protocol Client Details] The WOPI client issues requests to WOPI servers in order to: access information about files and folders. access the content of files and folders. change the content of files and folders.
[In WOPI Protocol Client Details] For details about WOPI client requests, see WOPI Protocol Server Details (see section 3.3).
[In WOPI Protocol Server Details] The WOPI server responds to WOPI requests from WOPI clients.
[In WOPI Protocol Server Details] It[The WOPI server] returns information about files and file content in its responses.
[In WOPI Protocol Server Details] The WOPI server never initiates communication with the WOPI client.
[In WOPI Protocol Server Details] Except where specified, WOPI clients SHOULD interpret HTTP Status-Codes returned by the WOPI server as specified in [RFC2616] section 10, "Status Code Definitions."
[In WOPI Protocol Server Details]The server SHOULD support ExecuteCellStorageRequest (see section 3.3.5.1.7) and ExcecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest (see section 3.3.5.1.8) operations.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R961.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In WOPI Protocol Server Details]The server SHOULD support ReadSecureStore (see section 3.3.5.1.10) operation.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R963.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Abstract Data Model] This section describes a conceptual model of possible file state management that an implementation maintains to participate in this protocol.
[In Abstract Data Model] The described model is provided to facilitate the explanation of how the protocol behaves.
[In Abstract Data Model] This document does not mandate that implementations adhere to this model as long as their external behavior is consistent with what is described in this document.
[In Abstract Data Model] The WOPI server SHOULD manage the state of files such that it can respond to WOPI requests appropriately based on the current state of the file.

[In Abstract Data Model] [The WOPI server SHOULD manage the state of files such that it can respond to WOPI requests appropriately based on the current state of the file, This state management includes but is not limited to:] User does not have permission to view or edit a file.

[In Abstract Data Model] [The WOPI server SHOULD manage the state of files such that it can respond to WOPI requests appropriately based on the current state of the file, This state management includes but is not limited to:] File is read-only.

[In Abstract Data Model] [The WOPI server SHOULD manage the state of files such that it can respond to WOPI requests appropriately based on the current state of the file, This state management includes but is not limited to:] File is locked for editing by another user.

[In Abstract Data Model] [The WOPI server SHOULD manage the state of files such that it can respond to WOPI requests appropriately based on the current state of the file, This state management includes but is not limited to:] File is checked out by another user.

[In Abstract Data Model] Additionally, the WOPI server SHOULD manage state in accordance with [MS-FSSHTTP] to enable some specific WOPI server operations as described in section 3.3.5.1.8 and section 3.3.5.1.9 of this document.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Resource "HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>" description is "Provides access to information about a file and allows for file-level operations."

[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] The resource of HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id> description is "Provides access to information about a folder and allows for folder level operations."
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Resource HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>/contents description is "Provides access to operations that get and update the contents of a file".
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Resource HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id>/children description is " Provides access to the files and folders in a folder".
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>] The file being accessed by WOPI is identified by the following URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>] The syntax URI parameters are defined by the following Augmented Backus-Naur Form (ABNF): id = STRING
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>] id: A string that specifies a unique identifier of a file managed by the WOPI server.
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>] [id] This string MUST be URL safe.

[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>] The following operations are allowed to be performed on this resource: CheckFileInfo PutRelativeFile Lock Unlock RefreshLock UnlockAndRelock ExecuteCellStorageRequest ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest DeleteFile
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>] Operation "CheckFileInfo" is used for "Returns information about a file.
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>] Operation "PutRelativeFile" is used for "Creates a copy of a file on the WOPI server".
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>] Operation "Lock" is used for "Takes a lock for editing a file".
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>] Operation "Unlock" is used for "Releases a lock for editing a file".
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>] Operation "RefreshLock" is used for "Refreshes a lock for editing a file".
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>] Operation "UnlockAndRelock" is used for "Releases and then retakes a lock for editing a file".
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>] Operation "ExecuteCellStorageRequest" is used for "Changes the contents of the file in accordance with [MS-FSSHTTP]".
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>] Operation "ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest" is used for "Changes the contents of the file in accordance with [MS-FSSHTTP]".
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>] Operation "DeleteFile" is used for "Removes a file from the WOPI server".
[In CheckFileInfo] Return information about the file and permissions that the current user has relative to that file.
[In CheckFileInfo] HTTP Verb: GET URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In CheckFileInfo] The following HTTP header MAY be included with this request:X-WOPI-SessionContext
[In CheckFileInfo] Header "X-WOPI-SessionContext" is used for "The value of the <sc> URI parameter (section 2.2.2)".
[In CheckFileInfo] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In CheckFileInfo] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In CheckFileInfo] Status code "401" means "Token is invalid".
[In CheckFileInfo] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User Unauthorized".
[In CheckFileInfo] Status code "500" means "Server error".

[In Response Body] The response body is JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) (as specified in [RFC4627]) with the following parameters: JSON: { [In Response Body] AllowExternalMarketplace: A Boolean value that indicates the WOPI client MAY allow connections to external services referenced in the file (for example, a marketplace of embeddable JavaScript apps).
[In Response Body] [AllowExternalMarketplace] If this value is false, then the WOPI client MUST NOT allow such connections.
[In Response Body] BaseFileName: The name of the file without the path.
[In Response Body] [BaseFileName] Used for display in user interface (UI), and determining the extension of the file.
[In Response Body] BreadcrumbBrandName: A string that the WOPI client MAY display to the user that indicates the brand name of the WOPI server.
[In Response Body] BreadcrumbBrandUrl: A URI to a web page that the WOPI client MAY navigate to when the user clicks on UI that displays BreadcrumbBrandName.
[In Response Body] BreadcrumbDocName: A string that the WOPI client MAY display to the user that indicates the name of the file.
[In Response Body] BreadcrumbDocUrl: A URI to a web page that the WOPI client MAY navigate to when the user clicks on UI that displays BreadcrumbDocName.
[In Response Body] BreadcrumbFolderName: A string that the WOPI client MAY display to the user that indicates the name of the folder that contains the file.
[In Response Body] BreadcrumbFolderUrl: A URI to a web page that the WOPI client MAY navigate to when the user clicks on UI that displays BreadcrumbFolderName.
[In Response Body] ClientUrl: A user-accessible URI directly to the file intended for opening the file through a client.
[In Response Body] [ClientUrl] Can be a DAV URL ([RFC5323]), but MAY be any URL that can be handled by a client that can open a file of the given type.

[In Response Body] CloseButtonClosesWindow: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI client SHOULD close the browser window containing the output of the WOPI client when the user call the close UI.

[In Response Body] ClosePostMessage: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI client SHOULD notify the WOPI server in the event that the user closes the rendering or editing client currently using this file.
[In Response Body] CloseURL: A URI to a web page that the implementer deems useful to a user in the event that the user closes the rendering or editing client currently using this file.
[In Response Body] DisableBrowserCachingOfUserContent: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI client MUST disable caching of file contents in the browser cache.
[In Response Body] DisablePrint: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI client MUST disable any print functionality under its control.
[In Response Body] DisableTranslation: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI client MUST NOT permit the use of machine translation functionality that is exposed by the WOPI client.
[In Response Body] DownloadUrl: A user-accessible URI to the file intended to allow the user to download a copy of the file.
[In Response Body] EditAndReplyUrl: A URI to a web page that provides an editing experience for the file, utilizing the WOPI client.
[In Response Body] EditModePostMessage: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI client SHOULD notify the WOPI server in the event that the user attempts to edit the file.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R292002001,MS-WOPI_R292002002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] EditNotificationPostMessage: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI client SHOULD notify the WOPI server in the event that the user attempts to edit the file.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R292003001, MS-WOPI_R292003002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] FileExtension: A string specifying the file extension of the file.
[In Response Body] This value [FileExtension] MUST begin with a ".".
[In Response Body] FileNameMaxLength: An integer indicating the maximum length for file names, including the file extension, supported by the WOPI server.
[In Response Body] FileSharingUrl: A URI to a location that allows the user to share the file.
[In Response Body] FileSharingPostMessage: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI client SHOULD notify the WOPI server in the event that the user attempts to share the file.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R292006001, MS-WOPI_R292006002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] FileUrl: A URI to the file location that the WOPI client uses to get the file.
[In Response Body] [FileUrl] If this is provided, a WOPI client MUST use this URI to get the file instead of HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>/contents (see section 3.3.5.3).
[In Response Body] HostAuthenticationId: A string that is used by the WOPI server to uniquely identify the user.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R952.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] HostAuthenticationId: A string that is used by the WOPI server to uniquely for a sample of N (default N=2) identify the users.
[In Response Body] HostEditUrl: A URI to a web page that provides an editing experience for the file, utilizing the WOPI client.
[In Response Body] HostEmbeddedEditUrl: A URI to a web page that provides access to an editing experience for the file that can be embedded in another HTML page.
[In Response Body] [HostEmbeddedEditUrl] For example, a page that provides an HTML snippet that can be inserted into the HTML of a blog.
[In Response Body] HostEmbeddedViewUrl: A URI to a web page that provides access to a viewing experience for the file that can be embedded in another HTML page.
[In Response Body] [HostEmbeddedViewUrl] For example, a page that provides an HTML snippet that can be inserted into the HTML of a blog.
[In Response Body] HostName: A string that is the name provided by the WOPI server used to identify it for logging and other informational purposes.
[In Response Body] HostNotes: A string that is used by the WOPI server to pass arbitrary information to the WOPI client.
[In Response Body] [HostNotes] The WOPI client MAY ignore this string if it does not recognize the contents.
[In Response Body] [HostNotes] A WOPI server MUST NOT require that a WOPI client understand the contents of this string to operate.
[In Response Body] HostRestUrl: A URI that is the base URI for REST operations for the file.
[In Response Body] HostViewUrl: A URI to a web page that provides a viewing experience for the file utilizing the WOPI client.
[In Response Body] IrmPolicyDescription: A string that the WOPI client SHOULD display to the user indicating the Information Rights Management (IRM) policy for the file.
[In Response Body] [IrmPolicyDescription] This value SHOULD be combined with IrmPolicyTitle.
[In Response Body] IrmPolicyTitle: A string that the WOPI client SHOULD display to the user indicating the IRM policy for the file.
[In Response Body] [IrmPolicyTitle] This value SHOULD be combined with IrmPolicyDescription.
[In Response Body] LicenseCheckInEditIsEnabled: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI client SHOULD take measures to ensure the user is properly licensed prior to allowing editing of the file.
[In Response Body] OwnerId: A string that SHOULD uniquely identify the owner of the file.
[In Response Body] PostMessageOrigin: A string that the WOPI client MUST use as the targetOrigin parameter when sending messages as described in [W3C-HTML5WEBMSG].

[In Response Body] PresenceProvider: A string that identifies the provider of information that a WOPI client MAY use to discover information about the user’s online status (for example, whether a user is available via instant messenger).
[In Response Body] [PresenceProvider] A WOPI client requires knowledge of specific presence providers to be able to take advantage of this value.
[In Response Body] PresenceUserId: A string that identifies the user in the context of the PresenceProvider.
[In Response Body] PrivacyUrl: A URI to a webpage that explains the privacy policy of the WOPI server.
[In Response Body] ProtectInClient: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI client SHOULD take measures to prevent copying and printing of the file.
[In Response Body] [ProtectInClient] This is intended to help enforce IRM in WOPI clients.
[In Response Body] ReadOnly: Indicates that, for this user, the file cannot be changed.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R925, MS-WOPI_R927.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] ReadOnly is a Boolean value.
[In Response Body] If the value of ReadOnly is false, indicates that, for this user, the file can be changed.
[In Response Body] RestrictedWebViewOnly: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI client MUST NOT allow the user to download the file or open the file in a separate application.
[In Response Body] SHA256: If it is present and not empty, it is a 256 bit SHA-2-encoded [FIPS180-2] hash of the file contents.
[In Response Body] SignInUrl: A URI that will sign the current user into the WOPI server supported authentication system.
[In Response Body] SignoutUrl: A URI that will sign the current user out of the WOPI server supported authentication system.
[In Response Body] Size: The size of the file expressed in bytes.
[In Response Body] SupportsCoauth: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI server supports multiple users making changes to this file simultaneously.<1>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R950.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] SupportsCoauth is a Boolean value. <1>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R950001, MS-WOPI_R950002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] SupportsCobalt: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI server supports ExecuteCellStorageRequest (see section 3.3.5.1.8) and ExcecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest (see section 3.3.5.1.9) operations for this file.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R775, MS-WOPI_R776.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] SupportsCobalt is a Boolean value.

[In Response Body] If the value of SupportsCobalt is true, indicates that the WOPI server supports ExecuteCellStorageRequest (see section 3.3.5.1.8) and ExcecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest (see section 3.3.5.1.9) operations for this file.
[In Response Body] SupportsExtendedLockLength: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI server supports lock IDs up to 1024 ASCII characters in length.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R776001001, MS-WOPI_R776001002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] SupportsExtendedLockLength is a Boolean value.
[In Response Body] If the value of SupportsExtendedLockLength is true, indicates that the WOPI server supports lock IDs up to 1024 ASCII characters in length.
[In Response Body] SupportsFileCreation: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI server supports creating new files using the WOPI client.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R776002001, MS-WOPI_R776002002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] SupportsFileCreation is a Boolean value.
[In Response Body] If the value of SupportsFileCreation is true, indicates that the WOPI server supports creating new files using the WOPI client.

[In Response Body] SupportsFolders: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI server supports EnumerateChildren (see section 3.3.5.4.1) and DeleteFile (see section 3.3.5.1.10) operations for this file.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R777, MS-WOPI_R778.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] SupportsFolders is a Boolean value.

[In Response Body] The value of SupportsFolders is true,indicates that the WOPI server supports EnumerateChildren (see section 3.3.5.4.1) and DeleteFile (see section 3.3.5.1.9) operations for this file.
[In Response Body] SupportsGetLock: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI server supports GetLock (see section 3.3.5.1.7).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R778001001, MS-WOPI_R778001002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] SupportsGetLock is a Boolean value.
[In Response Body] If the value of SupportsGetLock is true, indicates that the WOPI server supports GetLock (see section 3.3.5.1.7).

[In Response Body] SupportsLocks: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI server supports Lock (see section 3.3.5.1.3), Unlock (see section 3.3.5.1.4), RefreshLock (see section 3.3.5.1.5), and UnlockAndRelock (see section 3.3.5.1.6) operations for this file.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R779, MS-WOPI_R780.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] SupportsLocks is a Boolean value.

[In Response Body] If the value of SupportsLocks is true, indicates that the WOPI server supports Lock (see section 3.3.5.1.3), Unlock (see section 3.3.5.1.4), RefreshLock (see section 3.3.5.1.5), and UnlockAndRelock (see section 3.3.5.1.6) operations for this file.
[In Response Body] SupportsRename: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI server supports RenameFile (see section 3.3.5.1.14).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R780001001, MS-WOPI_R780001002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] SupportsRename is a Boolean value.
[In Response Body] If the value of SupportsRename is true, indicates that the WOPI server supports RenameFile (see section 3.3.5.1.14).
[In Response Body] SupportsScenarioLinks: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI server supports scenarios where users can operate on files in limited ways via restricted URLs.
[In Response Body] SupportsSecureStore: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI server supports calls to a secure data store utilizing credentials stored in the file.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R923, MS-WOPI_R924.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] SupportsSecureStore is a Boolean value.
[In Response Body] If the value of SupportsSecureStore is true, indicates that the WOPI server supports calls to a secure data store utilizing credentials stored in the file.
[In Response Body] SupportsUpdate: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI server supports PutFile (see section 3.3.5.3.2) and PutRelativeFile (see section 3.3.5.1.2) operations for this file.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R783, MS-WOPI_R784.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] SupportsUpdate is a Boolean value.

[In Response Body] If the value of SupportsUpdate is true, indicates that the WOPI server supports PutFile (see section 3.3.5.3.2) and PutRelativeFile (see section 3.3.5.1.2) operations for this file.
[In Response Body] SupportsUserInfo: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI server supports PutUserInfo (see section 3.3.5.1.15).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R784001001, MS-WOPI_R784001002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] SupportsUserInfo is a Boolean value.
[In Response Body] If the value of SupportsUserInfo is true, indicates that the WOPI server supports PutUserInfo (see section 3.3.5.1.15).
[In Response Body] TenantId: A string that is used by the WOPI server to uniquely identify the tenant.
[In Response Body] TermsOfUseUrl: A URI to a webpage that explains the terms of use policy of the WOPI server.
[In Response Body] TimeZone: A string that is used to pass time zone information to a WOPI client in the format chosen by the WOPI server.
[In Response Body] UniqueContentId: A string that uniquely represents the file contents.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R335001001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] UniqueContentId is a string.
[In Response Body] UniqueContentId: This value MUST change when the file content changes.
[In Response Body] UniqueContentId: This value MUST also be equivalent for all files with equivalent contents.
[In Response Body] UserCanAttend: A Boolean value that indicates that the user has permission to view a broadcast of this file.
[In Response Body] [UserCanAttend] A broadcast is file activity that involves one or more presenters controlling the view of the file for a set of attendees.
[In Response Body] [UserCanAttend] For example, a slideshow can be broadcast by a presenter to many attendees.
[In Response Body] UserCanNotWriteRelative: A Boolean value that indicates the user does not have sufficient permissions to create new files on the WOPI server.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R920, MS-WOPI_R922.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] UserCanNotWriteRelative is a Boolean value.
[In Response Body]If the value of UserCanNotWriteRelative is false, indicates the user have sufficient permissions to create new files on the WOPI server.
[In Response Body] UserCanPresent: A Boolean user has permission to broadcast this file to a set of users who have permission to broadcast or view a broadcast of this file
[In Response Body] [UserCanPresent] A broadcast is file activity that involves one or more presenters controlling the view of the file for a set of attendees.
[In Response Body] [UserCanPresent] For example, a slideshow can be broadcast by a presenter to many attendees.
[In Response Body] UserCanRename: A Boolean value that indicates the user has permissions to rename the file.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R342001001, MS-WOPI_R342001002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] UserCanRename is a Boolean value.
[In Response Body] If the value of UserCanRename is true, indicates that the user has permissions to rename the file.
[In Response Body] UserCanWrite: A Boolean value that indicates that the user has permissions to alter the file.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-WOPI_R928, MS-WOPI_R929.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] UserCanWrite is a Boolean value.
[In Response Body] If the value of UserCanWrite is true, indicates that the user has permissions to alter the file.
[In Response Body] UserFriendlyName: A string that is the name of the user.
[In Response Body] [UserFriendlyName] If blank, the WOPI client MAY be configured to use a placeholder string in some scenarios, or to show no name at all.
[In Response Body] UserId: A string that is used by the WOPI server to uniquely identify the user.
[In Response Body] UserInfo: A string that the WOPI client SHOULD use to verify the user’s licensing status.
[In Response Body] The WOPI client MAY ignore this string [UserInfo] if it does not recognize the contents.
[In Response Body] Version: A string representing the current version of the file based on the WOPI server’s file versioning schema.
[In Response Body] [Version] This value MUST change when the file content changes.
[In Response Body] [Version] version values MUST never repeat for a given file.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R931.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] [Version] Implementation does uniquely for a sample of N (default N=2) identify the version of the file.
[In Response Body] WebEditingDisabled: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI client MUST NOT allow the user to use the WOPI client’s editing functionality to operate on the file.
[In Response Body] [WebEditingDisabled] This does not mean that the user doesn’t have rights to edit the file.
[In Processing Details] The id represents the file that the WOPI server is providing information about.
[In Processing Details] The token represents the credentials that the WOPI server MUST use when determining the permissions the WOPI client has when interacting with the file.
[In PutRelativeFile] Create a new file on the WOPI server based on the current file.
[In PutRelativeFile] HTTP Verb: POST URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>

[In PutRelativeFile] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers: X-WOPI-Override X-WOPI-SuggestedTarget X-WOPI-RelativeTarget X-WOPI-OverwriteRelativeTarget X-WOPI-Size
[In PutRelativeFile] [HTTP header] X-WOPI-Override is a string specifying the requested operation from the WOPI server.
[In PutRelativeFile] X-WOPI-Override is Required.
[In PutRelativeFile] X-WOPI-Override's value is string "PUT_RELATIVE".
[In PutRelativeFile] [HTTP header] X-WOPI-SuggestedTarget is a UTF-7 string specifying either a file extension or a full file name.
[In PutRelativeFile] If only the [X-WOPI-SuggestedTarget] extension is provided, the name of the initial file without extension SHOULD be combined with the extension to create the proposed name.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R788.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PutRelativeFile] The WOPI server MUST modify the proposed name as needed to create a new file that is both legally named and does not overwrite any existing file, while preserving the file extension.
[In PutRelativeFile] This header[X-WOPI-SuggestedTarget] MUST be present if X-WOPI-RelativeTarget is not present.
[In PutRelativeFile] X-WOPI-SuggestedTarget value is a string that is a file extension or a full file name.
[In PutRelativeFile] [HTTP header] X-WOPI-RelativeTarget is a UTF-7 string that specifies a full file name.
[In PutRelativeFile] The WOPI server MUST NOT modify the name [X-WOPI-RelativeTarget] to fulfill the request.
[In PutRelativeFile] X-WOPI-RelativeTarget value is a string that is a full file name.
[In PutRelativeFile] [HTTP header] X-WOPI-OverwriteRelativeTarget is a Boolean value that specifies whether the host MUST overwrite the file name if it exists.
[In PutRelativeFile] If the X-WOPI-OverwriteRelativeTarget is a true value and the file exists, the host MUST overwrite the file.
[In PutRelativeFile] If the X-WOPI-OverwriteRelativeTarget is a false value and the file exists, the host MUST return the status code of 409.
[In PutRelativeFile] X-WOPI-OverwriteRelativeTarget value is a Boolean value.
[In PutRelativeFile] X-WOPI-Size is an integer that specifies the size of the file in bytes.
[In PutRelativeFile] X-WOPI-Size value is an integer.
[In PutRelativeFile] The response message for this operation can contain the following HTTP headers. X-WOPI-ValidRelativeTarget X-WOPI-Lock X-WOPI-LockFailureReason X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface
[In PutRelativeFile] X-WOPI-ValidRelativeTarget is a UTF-7 string provided by the WOPI server that the WOPI client MAY use as the value of X-WOPI-RelativeTarget in a future PutRelativeFile operation.
[In PutRelativeFile] This header [X-WOPI-ValidRelativeTarget] MAY be included when responding with the following status codes: 400
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R370003001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PutRelativeFile] This header [X-WOPI-ValidRelativeTarget] MAY be included when responding with the following status codes: 409
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R370004001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PutRelativeFile] X-WOPI-ValidRelativeTarget is a string.
[In PutRelativeFile] X-WOPI-Lock is a string provided by the WOPI client that the WOPI server MUST use to identify the lock on the file.
[In PutRelativeFile] This header [X-WOPI-Lock] MUST only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
[In PutRelativeFile] X-WOPI-Lock is a string.
[In PutRelativeFile] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string indicating why the operation failed.
[In PutRelativeFile] There is no standard for how this string [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] is to be formatted.
[In PutRelativeFile] This string [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.
[In PutRelativeFile] This header [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R370012001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PutRelativeFile] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string.
[In PutRelativeFile] X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface is a string "true" indicating that the file is currently locked by another client.
[In PutRelativeFile] This header [X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R370015001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PutRelativeFile] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In PutRelativeFile] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In PutRelativeFile] Status code "400" means "Specified name is illegal".
[In PutRelativeFile] Status code "401" means "Token is invalid".
[In PutRelativeFile] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In PutRelativeFile] Status code "409" means "Target file already exists".
[In PutRelativeFile] Status code "409" means "Target file already is locked".
[In PutRelativeFile] If the target file is locked, an X-WOPI-Lock response header containing the value of the current lock on the file MUST be included.
[In PutRelativeFile] Status code "413" means "File is too large."
[In PutRelativeFile] [Status code "413" means "File is too large." ]The maximum size is implementation-specific.
[In PutRelativeFile] Status code "500" means "Server error".
[In PutRelativeFile] Status code "501" means "Unsupported".
[In Request Body] The binary contents of the file.

[In Response Body] [Name] The response body is JSON (as specified in [RFC4627]) with the following parameters: JSON: { "Name":{"type":"string","optional":false}, "Url":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":false}, "HostViewUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "HostEditUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, }
[In Response Body] Name: The name of the file without the path.
[In Response Body] URL: A URI that is the WOPI server URI of the newly created file in the form: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In Response Body] Where id is the WOPI server’s id for the new file.
[In Response Body] The token is the WOPI server’s credentials token for accessing the new file.
[In Response Body] HostViewUrl: A URI to a web page that provides a viewing experience for the new file utilizing the WOPI client.
[In Response Body] HostEditUrl: A URI to a web page that provides an editing experience for the new file utilizing the WOPI client.
[In Processing Details] The WOPI server MUST use the content in the POST body to create a new file.
[In Processing Details] The rules for naming the new file and handling errors are described in the introductory section of this operation.
[In Lock] Take a lock for editing a file.
[In Lock] HTTP Verb: POST URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In Lock] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers: X-WOPI-Override X-WOPI-Lock
[In Lock] X-WOPI-Override is a string specifying the requested operation from the WOPI server.
[In Lock] X-WOPI-Override is Required.
[In Lock] X-WOPI-Override value is string "LOCK".
[In Lock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string provided by the WOPI client that the WOPI server MUST use to identify the lock on the file.
[In Lock] X-WOPI-Lock is Required.
[In Lock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string.
[In Lock] The response message for this operation can contain the following HTTP headers: X-WOPI-Lock X-WOPI-LockFailureReason X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface
[In Lock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string provided by the WOPI client that the WOPI server MUST use to identify the lock on the file.
[In Lock] This header [X-WOPI-Lock] MUST be included when responding with the 409 status code.
[In Lock] This header [X-WOPI-Lock] SHOULD NOT be included when responding with the 200 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R401002001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Lock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string.
[In Lock] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string indicating why the operation failed.
[In Lock] There is no standard for how this string [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] is to be formatted.
[In Lock] This string [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.
[In Lock] This header [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R401007001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Lock] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string.
[In Lock] X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface is a string "true" indicating that the file is currently locked by another client.
[In Lock] This header [X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R401010001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Lock] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In Lock] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In Lock] Status code "401" means "Token is invalid".
[In Lock] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In Lock] Status code "409" means "Lock mismatch".
[In Lock] Status code "409" means "locked by another interface".
[In Lock] an X-WOPI-Lock response header containing the value of the current lock on the file MUST be included when using this response code [409].
[In Lock] Status code "500" means "Server error".
[In Lock] Status code "501" means "Unsupported".
[In Processing Details] The WOPI server MUST use the string provided in the X-WOPI-Lock header to create a lock on a file.
[In Processing Details] When a WOPI client has a lock on a file the WOPI client is able to safely make changes to the file.
[In Processing Details] The lock MUST last for 30 minutes, unless modified by a subsequent WOPI client operation.
[In Unlock] Release a lock for editing a file.
[In Unlock] HTTP Verb: POST URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In Unlock] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers: X-WOPI-Override X-WOPI-Lock
[In Unlock] X-WOPI-Override is a string specifying the requested operation from the WOPI server.
[In Unlock] X-WOPI-Override is Required.
[In Unlock] X-WOPI-Override value is string "UNLOCK".
[In Unlock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string provided by the WOPI client that the WOPI server MUST use to identify the lock on the file.
[In Unlock] X-WOPI-Lock is Required.
[In Unlock] X-WOPI-Lock value is string provided by the WOPI client through Lock (see section 3.3.5.1.3)
[In Unlock] The response message for this operation can contain the following HTTP headers. X-WOPI-Lock X-WOPI-LockFailureReason X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface
[In Unlock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string provided by the WOPI client that the WOPI server MUST use to identify the lock on the file.
[In Unlock] This header [X-WOPI-Lock] MUST be included when responding with the 409 status code.
[In Unlock] This header [X-WOPI-Lock] SHOULD NOT be included when responding with the 200 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R422004001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Unlock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string.
[In Unlock] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string indicating why the operation failed.
[In Unlock] There is no standard for how this string [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] is to be formatted.
[In Unlock] This string [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.
[In Unlock] This header [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R422009001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Unlock] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string.
[In Unlock] X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface is a string "true" indicating that the file is currently locked by another client.
[In Unlock] This header [X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R422012001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Unlock] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In Unlock] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In Unlock] Status code "401" means "Token is invalid".
[In Unlock] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In Unlock] Status code "409" means "Lock mismatch".
[In Unlock] Status code "409" means "locked by another interface".
[In Unlock] an X-WOPI-Lock response header containing the value of the current lock on the file MUST be included when using this response code [409].
[In Unlock] Status code "500" means "Server error".
[In Unlock] Status code "501" means "Unsupported".
[In Processing Details] By releasing a lock, the WOPI client is indicating that it is not making further changes to a file.
[In RefreshLock] Refresh an existing lock for modifying a file.
[In RefreshLock] HTTP Verb: POST URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In RefreshLock] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers: X-WOPI-Override X-WOPI-Lock
[In RefreshLock] X-WOPI-Override is a string specifying the requested operation from the WOPI server.
[In RefreshLock] X-WOPI-Override is Required.
[In RefreshLock] X-WOPI-Override value is string "REFRESH_LOCK".
[In RefreshLock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string provided by the WOPI client that the WOPI server MUST use to identify the lock on the file.
[In RefreshLock] X-WOPI-Lock is Required.
[In RefreshLock] X-WOPI-Lock value is string provided by the WOPI client through Lock (see section 3.3.5.1.3).
[In RefreshLock] The response message for this operation can contain the following HTTP headers. X-WOPI-Lock X-WOPI-LockFailureReason X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface
[In RefreshLock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string provided by the WOPI client that the WOPI server MUST use to identify the lock on the file.
[In RefreshLock] This header [X-WOPI-Lock] MUST included when responding with the 409 status code.
[In RefreshLock] This header [X-WOPI-Lock] SHOULD NOT be included when responding with the 200 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R439004001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RefreshLock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string.
[In RefreshLock] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string indicating why the operation failed.
[In RefreshLock] There is no standard for how this string [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] is to be formatted.
[In RefreshLock] This string [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.
[In RefreshLock] This header [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R439009001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RefreshLock] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string.
[In RefreshLock] X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface is a string "true" indicating that the file is currently locked by another client.
[In RefreshLock] This header [X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R439012001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RefreshLock] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In RefreshLock] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In RefreshLock] Status code "401" means "Token is invalid".
[In RefreshLock] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In RefreshLock] Status code "409" means "Lock mismatch".
[In RefreshLock] Status code "409" means "locked by another interface".
[In RefreshLock] an X-WOPI-Lock response header containing the value of the current lock on the file MUST be included when using this response code.
[In RefreshLock] Status code "500" means "Server error".
[In RefreshLock] Status code "501" means "Unsupported".
[In Processing Details] Renews an existing lock on a file.
[In Processing Details] The lock MUST expire 30 minutes after this operation unless the lock is modified by a subsequent WOPI client operation.
[In UnlockAndRelock] Release and retake a lock for editing a file.
[In UnlockAndRelock] HTTP Verb: POST URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In UnlockAndRelock] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers: X-WOPI-Override X-WOPI-Lock X-WOPI-OldLock
[In UnlockAndRelock] X-WOPI-Override is a string specifying the requested operation from the WOPI server.
[In UnlockAndRelock] X-WOPI-Override is Required.
[In UnlockAndRelock] X-WOPI-Override value is string "LOCK".
[In UnlockAndRelock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string provided by the WOPI client that the WOPI server MUST use to identify the lock on the file.
