[In UnlockAndRelock] X-WOPI-Lock is Required.
[In UnlockAndRelock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string.
[In UnlockAndRelock] X-WOPI-OldLock is a string previously provided by the WOPI client that the WOPI server MUST have used to identify the lock on the file.
[In UnlockAndRelock] X-WOPI-OldLock is Required.
[In UnlockAndRelock] The [X-WOPI-OldLock] string provided by the WOPI client through Lock (see section 3.3.5.1.3).
[In UnlockAndRelock] The response message for this operation can contain the following HTTP headers. X-WOPI-Lock X-WOPI-LockFailureReason X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface
[In UnlockAndRelock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string provided by the WOPI client that the WOPI server MUST use to identify the lock on the file.
[In UnlockAndRelock] This header [X-WOPI-Lock] MUST be included when responding with the 409 status code.
[In UnlockAndRelock] This header [X-WOPI-Lock] SHOULD NOT be included when responding with the 200 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R460004001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In UnlockAndRelock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string.
[In UnlockAndRelock] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string indicating why the operation failed.
[In UnlockAndRelock] There is no standard for how this string [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] is to be formatted.
[In UnlockAndRelock] This string MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.
[In UnlockAndRelock] This header [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R460009001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In UnlockAndRelock] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string.
[In UnlockAndRelock] X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface is a string "true" indicating that the file is currently locked by another client.
[In UnlockAndRelock] This header [X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R460012001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In UnlockAndRelock] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In UnlockAndRelock] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In UnlockAndRelock] Status code "401" means "Token is invalid".
[In UnlockAndRelock] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In UnlockAndRelock] Status code "409" means "Lock mismatch".
[In UnlockAndRelock] Status code "409" means "locked by another interface".
[In UnlockAndRelock] an X-WOPI-Lock response header containing the value of the current lock on the file MUST be included when using this response code.
[In UnlockAndRelock] Status code "500" means "Server error".
[In UnlockAndRelock] Status code "501" means "Unsupported".
[In Processing Details] The WOPI server uses the X-WOPI-OldLock to identify which lock to release, and the X-WOPI-Lock as the id of the new lock.
[In Processing Details] The new lock MUST expire 30 minutes after this operation, unless modified by a subsequent WOPI client action.
[In GetLock] Retrieve a lock for editing a file.
[In GetLock] HTTP Verb: POST URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In GetLock] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers. X-WOPI-Override
[In GetLock] X-WOPI-Override is a string specifying the requested operation from the WOPI server.
[In GetLock] X-WOPI-Override is Required.
[In GetLock] X-WOPI-Override value is string "GET_LOCK".
[In GetLock] The response message for this operation can contain the following HTTP headers. X-WOPI-Lock X-WOPI-LockFailureReason X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface
[In GetLock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string provided by the WOPI client that the WOPI server MUST use to identify the lock on the file.
[In GetLock] This header [X-WOPI-Lock] MUST be included when responding with the following status code: 200
[In GetLock] This header [X-WOPI-Lock] MUST be included when responding with the following status code: 409
[In GetLock] X-WOPI-Lock is a string.
[In GetLock] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string indicating why the operation failed.
[In GetLock] There is no standard for how this string [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] is to be formatted.
[In GetLock] This string [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason]MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.
[In GetLock] This header [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R469015001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In GetLock] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string.
[In GetLock] X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface is a string indicating "true" that the file is currently locked by another client.
[In GetLock] This header [X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R469018001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In GetLock] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In GetLock] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In GetLock] Status code "401" means "Token is invalid".
[In GetLock] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In GetLock] Status code "409" means "Lock mismatch".
[In GetLock] Status code "409" means "locked by another interface".
[In GetLock] an X-WOPI-Lock response header containing the value of the current lock on the file MUST be included when using this response code.
[In GetLock] Status code "500" means "Server error".
[In GetLock] Status code "501" means "Unsupported".
[In Processing Details] Retrieves an existing lock on a file.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRequest] Make a change to a file using the standards defined by [MS-FSSHTTP].
[In ExecuteCellStorageRequest] HTTP Verb: POST URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In ExecuteCellStorageRequest] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers: X-WOPI-Override X-WOPI-Size
[In ExecuteCellStorageRequest] X-WOPI-Override is a string specifying requested operation from the WOPI server.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRequest] X-WOPI-Override is Required.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRequest] X-WOPI-Override's value is string "COBALT".
[In ExecuteCellStorageRequest] X-WOPI-Size is an integer specifying the size of the request body.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRequest] X-WOPI-Size is an integer.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRequest] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRequest] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In ExecuteCellStorageRequest] Status "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In ExecuteCellStorageRequest] Status code "500" means "Server error"
[In ExecuteCellStorageRequest] Status code "501" means "Unsupported".
[In Request Body] Content that conforms to the Body element specified in [MS-FSSHTTP] section 2.2.2.1.
[In Response Body] Content that conforms to the Body element specified in [MS-FSSHTTP] section 2.2.2.2.
[In Processing Details] Both the WOPI client and the WOPI server MUST follow the interaction model defined in [MS-FSSHTTP].
[In Processing Details] Success indicates that the request executed correctly.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] Make a change or create a new file in a location relative to the current file or folder using the standards defined by [MS-FSSHTTP].
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] HTTP Verb: POST URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers: X-WOPI-Override X-WOPI-Size X-WOPI-RelativeTarget
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] X-WOPI-Override is a string specifying the requested operation from the WOPI server.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] X-WOPI-Override is Required.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] X-WOPI-Override's value is string "COBALT".
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] X-WOPI-Size is an integer specifying the size of the request body.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] X-WOPI-Size is an integer.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] X-WOPI-RelativeTarget is a string that is the name of the file being created or changed by this operation.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] The location of this file is relative to the current file or folder.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] That is, it [X-WOPI-RelativeTarget] MUST be a sibling of a file and a child of a folder.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] X-WOPI-RelativeTarget is a string.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] Status code "500" means "Server error".
[In ExecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest] Status code "501" means "Unsupported".
[In Request Body] Content that conforms to the Body element specified in [MS-FSSHTTP] section 2.2.2.1.
[In Response Body] Content that conforms to the Body element specified in [MS-FSSHTTP] section 2.2.2.2.
[In Processing Details] Both the WOPI client and the WOPI server MUST follow the interaction model defined in [MS-FSSHTTP].
[In Processing Details] Success indicates that the request executed correctly.
[In DeleteFile] Delete a file.
[In DeleteFile] HTTP Verb: POST URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In DeleteFile] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers: X-WOPI-Override
[In DeleteFile] X-WOPI-Override is a string specifying requested operation from the WOPI server.
[In DeleteFile] X-WOPI-Override is Required.
[In DeleteFile] X-WOPI-Override's value is string "DELETE".
[In DeleteFile] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In DeleteFile] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In DeleteFile] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In DeleteFile] Status code "500" means "Server error".
[In DeleteFile] Status code "501" means "Unsupported".
[In Processing Details] The WOPI server MUST delete the file if possible, given the permissions and state of the file.
[In ReadSecureStore] Access the WOPI server's implementation of a secure store as specified in [MS-SSWPS].
[In ReadSecureStore] Note that the WOPI client is not required to implement [MS-SSWPS].
[In ReadSecureStore] However, an understanding of the protocol and the acquisition of information that is part of the protocol is required to use ReadSecureStore.
[In ReadSecureStore] HTTP Verb: POST URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In ReadSecureStore] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers: X-WOPI-Override X-WOPI-ApplicationId
[In ReadSecureStore] X-WOPI-Override is a string specifying requested operation from the WOPI server.
[In ReadSecureStore] X-WOPI-Override is Required.
[In ReadSecureStore] X-WOPI-Override's value is string "READ_SECURE_STORE".
[In ReadSecureStore] [MS-SSWPS] section 3.1.4.2 describes how a WOPI client obtains the application ID required to access a specific secure store.
[In ReadSecureStore] This value [X-WOPI-ApplicationId] is equal to the appId element of the application element nested under the CreateApplication element.
[In ReadSecureStore] This [X-WOPI-ApplicationId] value is required.
[In ReadSecureStore] X-WOPI-ApplicationId value of the Application ID.
[In ReadSecureStore] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In ReadSecureStore] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In ReadSecureStore] Status code "401" means "Token is invalid".
[In ReadSecureStore] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In ReadSecureStore] Status code "500" means "Server error".
[In ReadSecureStore] Status code "501" means "Unsupported".

[In Response Body] The response body is JSON (as specified in [RFC4627]) with the following parameters: JSON: { "UserName":{"type":"string","optional":false}, "Password":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":false}, "IsWindowsCredentials":{"type":"bool","default":"false","optional":true}, "IsGroup":{"type":"bool","default":"false","optional":true}, }
[In Response Body] UserName: The UserName (see [MS-SSWPS] section 2.2.5.4).
[In Response Body] Password: The Password (see [MS-SSWPS] section 2.2.5.4).
[In Response Body] IsWindowsCredentials: A Boolean value that specifies that UserName corresponds to WindowsUserName and Password corresponds to WindowsPassword (see [MS-SSWPS] section 2.2.5.4).
[In Response Body] IsGroup: A Boolean value that specifies that the secure store application is a Group (see [MS-SSWPS] section 2.2.5.5).
[In Processing Details] The WOPI client MAY use the credentials returned by the WOPI server to access other server types on behalf of the user.
[In GetRestrictedLink] Gets a link to a file through which a user is able to operate on a file in a limited way.
[In GetRestrictedLink] For example, a user might be allowed to change a file in the course of filling out a form while not having permission to freely edit the file.
[In GetRestrictedLink] HTTP Verb: POST URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In GetRestrictedLink] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers: X-WOPI-Override X-WOPI-RestrictedLink
[In GetRestrictedLink] X-WOPI-Override is a string specifying requested operation from the WOPI server.
[In GetRestrictedLink] X-WOPI-Override is Required.
[In GetRestrictedLink] X-WOPI-Override's value is string "GET_RESTRICTED_LINK".
[In GetRestrictedLink] X-WOPI-RestrictedLink a string specifying the type of restricted link being requested by the WOPI client.
[In GetRestrictedLink] The valid values of this[X-WOPI-RestrictedLink] string are determined through convention.
[In GetRestrictedLink] [X-WOPI-RestrictedLink]The only valid value currently is "FORMS".
[In GetRestrictedLink] X-WOPI-RestrictedLink is Required.
[In GetRestrictedLink] X-WOPI-RestrictedLink is a string that is a valid value for a restricted link type.
[In GetRestrictedLink] For example, X-WOPI-RestrictedLink value is "FORMS".
[In GetRestrictedLink] The response message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers: X-WOPI-RestrictedUseLink
[In GetRestrictedLink] X-WOPI-RestrictedUseLink is a string specifying the URL that the WOPI client requested.
[In GetRestrictedLink] For example, the[X-WOPI-RestrictedUseLink] URL that allows the user to fill out a form.
[In GetRestrictedLink] X-WOPI-RestrictedUseLink is Required.
[In GetRestrictedLink] X-WOPI-RestrictedUseLink is a string that is a valid URL.
[In GetRestrictedLink] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In GetRestrictedLink] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In GetRestrictedLink] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In GetRestrictedLink] Status code "500" means "Server error".
[In GetRestrictedLink] Status code "501' means "Unsupported".
[In Processing Details] This[GetRestrictedLink ] operation is directly related to the use of the X-WOPI-UsingRestrictedScenario HTTP header (section 2.2.1).
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] Revokes all links to a file through which a number of users are able to operate on a file in a limited way.
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] For example, users might be allowed to change a file in the course of filling out a form while not having permission to freely edit the file.
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] This operation will render all links of that type invalid.
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] HTTP Verb: POST URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers: X-WOPI-Override X-WOPI-RestrictedLink
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] X-WOPI-Override is a string specifying requested operation from the WOPI server.
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] X-WOPI-Override is Required.
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] X-WOPI-Override's value is string "REVOKE_RESTRICTED_LINK".
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] X-WOPI-RestrictedLink is a string specifying the type of restricted link being revoked by the WOPI client.
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] The valid values of this string are determined through convention.
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] The only valid value[X-WOPI-RestrictedLink] currently is "FORMS".
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] X-WOPI-RestrictedLink is a string that is a valid value for a restricted link type.
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] For example, X-WOPI-RestrictedLink value is "FORMS".
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] Status code "500" means "Server error".
[In RevokeRestrictedLink] Status code "501" means "Unsupported".
[In Processing Details] This operation is directly related to the use of the X-WOPI-UsingRestrictedScenario HTTP header (section 2.2.1).
[In RenameFile] Renames a file.
[In RenameFile] HTTP Verb: POST URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In RenameFile] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers. X-WOPI-Override X-WOPI-Lock X-WOPI-RequestedName
[In RenameFile] X-WOPI-Override is a string specifying the requested operation from the WOPI server.
[In RenameFile] X-WOPI-Override is Required.
[In RenameFile] X-WOPI-Override value is string "RENAME_FILE".
[In RenameFile] X-WOPI-Lock is a string provided by the WOPI client that the WOPI server MUST use to identify the lock on the file.
[In RenameFile] X-WOPI-Lock is Required.
[In RenameFile] X-WOPI-Lock is the string provided by the WOPI client through Lock (see section 3.3.5.1.3).
[In RenameFile] X-WOPI-RequestedName is a UTF-7 string that is a full file name.
[In RenameFile] X-WOPI-RequestedName is Required.
[In RenameFile] X-WOPI-RequestedName is a string.
[In RenameFile] The response message for this operation can contain the following HTTP headers. X-WOPI-InvalidFileNameError X-WOPI-Lock X-WOPI-LockFailureReason X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface
[In RenameFile] X-WOPI-InvalidFileNameError is a A string indicating why the operation failed.
[In RenameFile] There is no standard for how this string [X-WOPI-InvalidFileNameError] is to be formatted.
[In RenameFile] This string [X-WOPI-InvalidFileNameError] MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.
[In RenameFile] This header [X-WOPI-InvalidFileNameError] MAY only be included when responding with the 400 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R592017001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RenameFile] X-WOPI-InvalidFileNameError is string.
[In RenameFile] X-WOPI-Lock is a string provided by the WOPI client that the WOPI server MUST use to identify the lock on the file.
[In RenameFile] This header [X-WOPI-Lock] MUST be included when responding with the 409 status code.
[In RenameFile] This header [X-WOPI-Lock] SHOULD NOT be included when responding with the 200 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R592021001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RenameFile] X-WOPI-Lock is a string.
[In RenameFile] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string indicating why the operation failed.
[In RenameFile] There is no standard for how this string [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] is to be formatted.
[In RenameFile] This string [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.
[In RenameFile] This header [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R592026001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RenameFile] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string.
[In RenameFile] X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface is a string "true" indicating that the file is currently locked by another client.
[In RenameFile] This header [X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R592029001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RenameFile] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In RenameFile] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In RenameFile] Status code "401" means "Token is invalid".
[In RenameFile] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In RenameFile] Status code "400" means "Specified name is illegal"
[In RenameFile] Status code "409" means "Lock mismatch/locked by another interface;
[In RenameFile] an X-WOPI-Lock response header containing the value of the current lock on the file MUST be included when using this response code [409].
[In RenameFile] Status code "500" means "Server error"
[In RenameFile] Status code "501" means "Unsupported"
[In Response Body] Name: The name of the renamed file without the path or file extension.
[In PutUserInfo] Stores user information on the WOPI server.
[In PutUserInfo] HTTP Verb: POST URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In PutUserInfo] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers. X-WOPI-Override
[In PutUserInfo] X-WOPI-Override is a string specifying the requested operation from the WOPI server.
[In PutUserInfo] X-WOPI-Override is Required.
[In PutUserInfo] X-WOPI-Override value is string "PUT_USER_INFO"
[In PutUserInfo] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In PutUserInfo] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In PutUserInfo] Status code "401" means "Token is invalid".
[In PutUserInfo] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In PutUserInfo] Status code "500" means "Server error".
[In PutUserInfo] Status code "501" means "Unsupported".
[In Request Body] A string that the WOPI server MUST store.
[In Request Body] If stored, the WOPI server MUST associate it with the current user.
[In Request Body] The WOPI server SHOULD include this string in the UserInfo property.
[In Processing Details] The WOPI server MUST store the string passed in the request body and MUST associate it with the current user.
[In Processing Details] The WOPI server MUST include this string in the UserInfo property when responding to CheckFileInfo (see section 3.3.5.1.1) requests for this user.
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id>] The folder being accessed by WOPI is identified by the following URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id>
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id>] The syntax URI parameters are defined by the following ABNF: id = STRING
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id>] id: A unique identifier of a folder managed by the WOPI server.
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id>] The following operation is allowed to be performed on this resource: CheckFolderInfo
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id>] Operation "CheckFolderInfo" is used for "Returns information about a folder.
[In CheckFolderInfo] Return information about the folder and permissions that the current user has relative to that file.
[In CheckFolderInfo] HTTP Verb: GET URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id>?access_token=<token>
[In CheckFolderInfo] The following HTTP header MAY be included with this request: X-WOPI-SessionContext
[In CheckFolderInfo] Header X-WOPI-SessionContext which is the value of the <sc> URI parameter (section 2.2.2).

[In Response Body] The response body is JSON (as specified in [RFC4627]) with the following parameters: JSON: { "FolderName":{"type":"string","optional":false}, "BreadcrumbBrandIconUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "BreadcrumbBrandName":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "BreadcrumbBrandUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "BreadcrumbDocName":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "BreadcrumbDocUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "BreadcrumbFolderName":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "BreadcrumbFolderUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "ClientUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "CloseButtonClosesWindow":{"type":"bool","default":false,"optional":true}, "CloseUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "FileSharingUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "HostAuthenticationId"{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "HostEditUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "HostEmbeddedEditUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "HostEmbeddedViewUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "HostName":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "HostViewUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "OwnerId":{"type":"string","optional":false}, "PresenceProvider"{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "PresenceUserId"{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "PrivacyUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "SignoutUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "SupportsSecureStore":{"type":"bool","default":false,"optional":true}, "TenantId"{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "TermsOfUseUrl":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "UserCanWrite":{"type":"bool","default":false,"optional":true}, "UserFriendlyName":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "UserId":{"type":"string","default":"","optional":true}, "WebEditingDisabled":{"type":"bool","default":false,"optional":true}, }
[In Response Body] FolderName: The name of the folder without the path.
[In Response Body] [FolderName] Used for display in the UI.
[In Response Body] BreadcrumbBrandIconUrl: A URI to an image that the WOPI client MAY display to the user as the branding image of the WOPI server.
[In Response Body] BreadcrumbBrandName: A string that the WOPI client MAY display to the user that indicates the brand name of the WOPI server.
[In Response Body] BreadcrumbBrandUrl: A URI to a web page that the WOPI client MAY navigate to when the user clicks on the UI that displays BreadcrumbBrandName.
[In Response Body] BreadcrumbDocName: A string that the WOPI client MAY display to the user that indicates the name of the file.
[In Response Body] BreadcrumbDocUrl: A URI to a web page that the WOPI client MAY navigate to when the user clicks on the UI that displays BreadcrumbDocName.
[In Response Body] BreadcrumbFolderName: A string that the WOPI client MAY display to the user that indicates the name of the folder that contains the file.
[In Response Body] BreadcrumbFolderUrl: A URI to a web page that the WOPI client MAY navigate to when the user clicks on the UI that displays BreadcrumbFolderName.
[In Response Body] ClientUrl: A user-accessible URI directly to the folder intended for opening the file through a client.
[In Response Body] [ClientUrl] Can be a DAV URL ([RFC5323]), but MAY be any URL that can be handled by a client that can open a file of the given type.

[In Response Body] CloseButtonClosesWindow: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI client SHOULD close the browser window containing the output of the WOPI client when the user calls the close UI.
[In Response Body] CloseURL: A URI to a web page that the implementer deems useful to a user in the event that the user closes the rendering or editing client currently using this folder.
[In Response Body] FileSharingURL: A URI to a location that allows the user to share the file.
[In Response Body] HostAuthenticationId: A string that is used by the WOPI server to uniquely identify the user.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R742.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] HostAuthenticationId: A string that is used by the WOPI server to uniquely for a sample of N (default N=2) identify the users.
[In Response Body] HostEditUrl: A URI to a web page that provides an editing experience for the folder utilizing the WOPI client.
[In Response Body] HostEmbeddedEditUrl: A URI to a web page that provides access to an editing experience for the folder that can be embedded in another HTML page.
[In Response Body] [HostEmbeddedEditUrl] For example, a page that provides an HTML snippet that can be inserted into the HTML of a blog.
[In Response Body] HostEmbeddedViewUrl: A URI to a web page that provides access to a viewing experience for the folder that can be embedded in another HTML page.
[In Response Body] [HostEmbeddedViewUrl] For example, a page that provides an HTML snippet that can be inserted into the HTML of a blog.
[In Response Body] HostName: A string that is the name provided by the WOPI server used to identify it for logging and other informational purposes.
[In Response Body] HostViewUrl: A URI to a web page that provides a viewing experience for the folder utilizing the WOPI client.
[In Response Body] OwnerId: A string that SHOULD uniquely identify the owner of the file.

[In Response Body] PresenceProvider: A string that identifies the provider of information that a WOPI client MAY use to discover information about the user’s online status (for example, whether a user is available via instant messenger).
[In Response Body] [PresenceProvider] A WOPI client requires knowledge of specific presence providers to be able to take advantage of this value.
[In Response Body] PresenceUserId: A string that identifies the user in the context of the PresenceProvider.
[In Response Body] PrivacyUrl: A URI to a webpage that explains the privacy policy of the WOPI server.
[In Response Body] SignoutUrl: A URI that will sign the current user out of the WOPI server supported authentication system.
[In Response Body] SupportsSecureStore: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI server supports calls to a secure data store utilizing credentials stored in the file.
[In Response Body] TenantId: A string that is used by the WOPI server to uniquely identify the tenant.
[In Response Body] TermsOfUseUrl: A URI to a webpage that explains the terms of use policy of the WOPI server.
[In Response Body] UserCanWrite: Indicates that the user has permissions to alter the folder.
[In Response Body] UserFriendlyName: A string that is the name of the user.
[In Response Body] [UserFriendlyName] If blank, the WOPI client MAY be configured to to use a placeholder string in some scenarios, or to show no name at all.
[In Response Body] UserId: A string that is used by the WOPI server to uniquely identify the user.
[In Response Body] WebEditingDisabled: A Boolean value that indicates that the WOPI client MUST NOT allow the user to use the WOPI client’s editing functionality to operate on the file.

[In Response Body] [WebEditingDisabled] This[the WOPI client MUST NOT allow the user to use the WOPI client’s editing functionality to operate on the file] does not mean that the user doesn’t have rights to edit the file.
[In Processing Details] The id represents the folder that the WOPI server is providing information about.
[In Processing Details] The token represents the credentials that the WOPI server MUST use when determining the permissions the WOPI client has when interacting with the folder.
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>/contents] The content of a file being accessed by WOPI is identified by the following URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>/contents
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>/contents] The syntax URI parameters are defined by the following ABNF: id = STRING
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>/contents] id: A unique identifier of a file managed by the WOPI server.
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>/contents] The following operations are allowed to be performed on this resource: GetFile PutFile
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>/contents] Operation "GetFile" is used for "Request message to retrieve a file for the HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>/contents operation".
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>/contents] Operation "PutFile" is used for "Request message to update a file for the HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>/contents operation".
[In GetFile] Get a file.
[In GetFile] HTTP Verb: GET URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>/contents?access_token=<token>
[In GetFile] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers: X-WOPI-MaxExpectedSize
[In GetFile] X-WOPI-MaxExpectedSize is an integer specifying the upper bound of the expected size of the file being requested.
[In GetFile] X-WOPI-MaxExpectedSize is Optional.
[In GetFile] The WOPI server will use the maximum value of a 4-byte integer if this value is not set in the request.
[In GetFile] X-WOPI-MaxExpectedSize is an integer.
[In GetFile] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In GetFile] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In GetFile] Status code "401" means "Token is invalid".
[In GetFile] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In GetFile] Status code "500" means "Server error".
[In Response Body] The binary contents of the file.
[In Processing Details] The WOPI server MUST return the complete binary of the file identified by <id> in the response body, if the response indicates Success.
[In PutFile] Update a file on the WOPI server.
[In PutFile] HTTP Verb: POST URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>/contents?access_token=<token>
[In PutFile] The request message for this operation contains the following HTTP headers: X-WOPI-Override X-WOPI-Lock
[In PutFile] X-WOPI-Override is a string specifying the requested operation from the WOPI server.
[In PutFile] X-WOPI-Override is Required.
[In PutFile] X-WOPI-Override value is string "PUT".
[In PutFile] X-WOPI-Lock is a string provided by the WOPI client that the WOPI server used to identify the lock on the file.
[In PutFile] X-WOPI-Lock is Required.
[In PutFile] X-WOPI-Lock value is string provided by the WOPI client through Lock (see section 3.3.5.1.3).
[In PutFile] The response message for this operation can contain the following HTTP headers.
[In PutFile] X-WOPI-Lock is a string provided by the WOPI client that the WOPI server used to identify the lock on the file.
[In PutFile] This header [X-WOPI-Lock] MUST be included when responding with the 409 status code.
[In PutFile] This header [X-WOPI-Lock] SHOULD NOT be included when responding with the 200 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R685004001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PutFile] X-WOPI-Lock is a string.
[In PutFile] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string indicating why the operation failed.
[In PutFile] There is no standard for how this string [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] is to be formatted.
[In PutFile] This string [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] MUST NOT be used for anything other than logging.
[In PutFile] This header [X-WOPI-LockFailureReason] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R685009001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PutFile] X-WOPI-LockFailureReason is a string.
[In PutFile] X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface is a string "true" indicating that the file is currently locked by another client.
[In PutFile] This header [X-WOPI-LockedByOtherInterface] MAY only be included when responding with the 409 status code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-WOPI_R685012001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PutFile] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In PutFile] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In PutFile] Status code "401" means "Token is invalid".
[In PutFile] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In PutFile] Status code "409" means "Lock mismatch".
[In PutFile] Status code "409" means "Locked by another interface".
[In PutFile] an X-WOPI-Lock response header containing the value of the current lock on the file MUST be included when using this response code [409].
[In PutFile] Status code "413" means "File is too large".
[In PutFile] Status code "413" means "File is too large".] The maximum file size is implementation-specific.
[In PutFile] Status code "500" means "Server error".
[In PutFile] Status code "501" means "Unsupported".
[In Request Body] The binary contents of the file.
[In Processing Details] The WOPI server MUST update the binary of the file identified by <id> to match the binary contents in the request body, if the response indicates Success.

[In Processing Details] If the file is currently associated with a lock established by the Lock operation (see section 3.3.5.1.3) [or the UnlockAndRelock operation (see section 3.3.5.1.6)] the WOPI server MUST provide the matching lock value in order for this operation to succeed.

[In Processing Details] If the file is currently associated with a lock established by [the Lock operation (see section 3.3.5.1.3) or] the UnlockAndRelock operation (see section 3.3.5.1.6) the WOPI server MUST provide the matching lock value in order for this operation to succeed.
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id>/children] The contents of a folder being accessed by WOPI are identified by the following URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id>/children
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id>/children] The syntax URI parameters are defined by the following ABNF: id = STRING
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id>/children] id: A unique identifier of a folder managed by the WOPI server.
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id>/children] The following operation is allowed to be performed on this resource; EnumerateChildren
[In HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id>/children] Operation "EnumerateChildren" is used for "Returns a set of URIs that provides access to resources in the folder".
[In EnumerateChildren] The EnumerateChildren method returns the contents of a folder on the WOPI server.
[In EnumerateChildren] HTTP Verb: GET URI: HTTP://server/<...>/wopi*/folders/<id>/children?access_token=<token>
[In EnumerateChildren] The response message for this operation can result in the following status codes.
[In EnumerateChildren] Status code "200" means "Success".
[In EnumerateChildren] Status code "404" means "File unknown/User unauthorized".
[In EnumerateChildren] Status code "500" means "Server error".
[In EnumerateChildren] Status code "501" means "Unsupported".
[In Response Body] Name: The name of the child resource.

[In Response Body] Url: The URI of the child resource of the form http://server/<...>/wopi*/files/<id>?access_token=<token> where id is the WOPI server’s unique id of the resource and token is the token that provides access to the resource.
[In Response Body] Version: The current version of the resource based on the server’s file versioning schema.
[In Response Body] [Version] This value MUST change when the file changes.
[In Response Body] [Version] MUST match the value that would be provided by the "Version" field in the response to CheckFileInfo (see section 3.3.5.1.1).
[In Processing Details] The WOPI server returns URLs in the response body JSON that the WOPI client MAY then use to initiate further WOPI operations on the items in the folder.

[In Appendix C: Product Behavior] Unless otherwise specified, any statement of optional behavior in this specification that is prescribed using the terms SHOULD or SHOULD NOT implies product behavior in accordance with the SHOULD or SHOULD NOT prescription.
[In Appendix C: Product Behavior] Unless otherwise specified, the term MAY implies that the product does not follow the prescription.
[In Common URI Parameters] Implementation does support the token is scoped to a specific user and set of resources.(Microsoft SharePoint Foundation 2013 and above follow this behavior)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PutRelativeFile] [X-WOPI-SuggestedTarget] Implementation does support the name of the initial file without extension is combined with the extension to create the proposed name,if only the extension is provided.(Microsoft SharePoint Foundation 2013 and above follow this behavior)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In WOPI Protocol Server Details]Implementation does support ExecuteCellStorageRequest (see section 3.3.5.1.7) and ExcecuteCellStorageRelativeRequest (see section 3.3.5.1.8) operations.(Microsoft SharePoint Foundation 2013 and above follow this behavior)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In WOPI Protocol Server Details]Implementation does support ReadSecureStore (see section 3.3.5.1.10) operation.(Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013 and above follow this behavior)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Custom HTTP Headers] Implementation does not include details about the error in X-WOPI-ServerError. (SharePoint Server 2010 and above follow this hebavior).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Lock] Implementation does not include header X-WOPI-Lock when responding with the 200 status code. (SharePoint Server 2010 and above follows this behavior).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] Implementation does return a boolean value true as EditModePostMessage value when the WOPI client notifies the WOPI server in the event that the user attempts to edit the file. (SharePoint Foundation 2010 and above follows this behavior).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] Implementation does return a boolean value false as EditModePostMessage value when the WOPI client notify the WOPI server in the event that no user attempts to edit the file. (SharePoint Foundation 2010 and above follows this behavior).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] Implementation does return a boolean value true as EditNotificationPostMessage value when the WOPI client notifies the WOPI server in the event that the user attempts to edit the file. (SharePoint Foundation 2010 and above follows this behavior).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] Implementation does return a boolean value false as EditNotificationPostMessage value when the WOPI client notifies the WOPI server in the event that no user attempts to edit the file. (SharePoint Foundation 2010 and above follows this behavior).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Response Body] Implementation does return the value false for field SupportsCoauth. <1> Section 3.3.5.1.1.2: SharePoint Foundation 2013, SharePoint Server 2013 and above return the value false for the SupportsCoauth field.
